content:
Certainly! An example of a song without any harmony would be “Amazing Grace”. This song is typically performed a cappella, with only one voice singing the melody. While different harmonies have been added to the song over the years, the original melody of “Amazing Grace” is strong enough to stand on its own without any accompaniment or harmony. 

Another example of a song with a minimal harmony is "The Sound of Silence" by Simon & Garfunkel. The melody of the song stands out on its own, with the harmony consisting mainly of sustained chords played on a guitar. The lack of a complex harmony helps to emphasize the emotional power of the lyrics and melody of the song.
